title: Another Chinese firm buys stake in Masood Textile Mills
text:
Font size Email Print 
Chinese company Zhejiang Xinao Industry has acquired a 12.7% stake in Masood Textile Mills, one of the few vertically integrated textile and apparel makers in Pakistan. 
The company, which manufactures and distributes wool worsted yarns and wool tops, has bought 7.6m shares of Masood Textile Mills for an undisclosed price, according to a stock exchange filing. 
The deal comes after another Chinese firm, Shanghai Challenge Textile, acquired a 24.36% majority stake in Masood Textile Mills in December. The purchase of 14.6m shares constituted around one-quarter of the total shareholding. 
The Faisalabad-based firm has in-house yarn, fabric, processing, printing and knitted apparel facilities, and posted a 52% hike in net profit to PKR195.2m (US$1.9m) in the first quarter of this year. 
Earlier proposals by China's Shandong Ruyi Technology Group to take a majority stake in Masood Textile Mills were called off in September last year. 
Chinese firms have been eyeing Pakistan as a destination for investment in the textile and garment sectors following its accession to the EU's GSP+ duty-free scheme in January 2014. 
In addition, Pakistan’s second Textile Policy aims to double the country’s textile and clothing exports to US$26bn in the next five years. The ambitious plans for the period from 2014-19 will see authorities spend PKR65bn (US$650m) on subsidies and developing the infrastructure to attract investments of US$5bn in the sector. 
Under the policy, Pakistan’s textile and clothing exporters will be helped by subsidies of 4% on exports of woven and knitted garments, 2% on made-ups, and 1% on dyed and printed fabrics. 
Other key initiatives under the new policy include the creation of a Technology Up-gradation Fund (TUF), low interest rate loans under the Long Term Finance Facility (LTFF), and tax-free imports of machinery for garment makers. Loans under the Export Finance Scheme (EFS) will be provided at 7.5% to garment exporters.
